title: Music Patriarch Marsalis Sr. Dies (AP)
description: AP - Ellis L. Marsalis Sr., the patriarch of a family of world famous jazz musicians, including grandson Wynton Marsalis, has died. He was 96.

title: Yen Suffers as Oil Prices Hit Highs
description: LONDON (Reuters) - The yen sank to a four-month low against  the euro and a six-week low versus the dollar on Tuesday as  investors fretted that soaring oil prices could jeopardize  Japan's economic recovery.

title: 'Todd's' travels (Variety)
description: Variety - LONDON -- London's latest "Sweeney Todd" has turned into a "very significant hit," says lead producer \     Adam Kenwright. Its limited run at the Trafalgar Studios is skedded to end Oct. 9. Production will pack up and move two days later to the New Ambassadors, with the same producing team attached: Kenwright, \     Howard Panter's Ambassador Theater Group and \     Ted and \     Norman Tulchin's Maidstone Prods.

title: Sony #39;s PSP Launch Greeted by Long Lines of Buyers
description: Sony #39;s first hand-held game machine is vying to give Nintendo a run for its money in Japan this holiday season. Nintendo President Satoru Iwata is taking the news with a grain of salt.

title: Hazard Level Upped At Mount St. Helens
description: VANCOUVER, Wash. -- A second steam eruption at Mount St. Helens and changes in seismic signals prompted the government to raise the volcano alert to Level Three on Saturday afternoon.

title: Bluegrass Staple Skaggs Back with 'Strings'
description: NEW YORK (Billboard) - After several years spent exploring  the roots and branches of bluegrass music with his recordings,  Ricky Skaggs is satisfying his critics with an album of all new  material.

description: AP - In every other city, Barry Bonds is greeted with boos and cheers, a mixture of respect, fear and derision for the best slugger of his generation.

title: Group to focus on fund management
description: HONG KONG (CBS.MW) -- London-based financial services group HHG surged Friday after agreeing to sell its life insurance and pensions business to private equity investors for 1.025 billion pounds (\$1.96 billion) in cash.

title: Kerry tells voters  #39;wake up #39; to choice
description: John Kerry told American voters yesterday to  quot;wake up quot; and realize they have a choice for a different direction in a president and commander in chief when they go to the polls on Tuesday.

title: IBM beefs up ISV programs
description: Hoping to both bolster resources available to its network of business partners as well as expand its number of partners, IBM on Tuesday introduced services and support programs that boost financial support for co-marketing campaigns and grant deeper access to IBMs sales network to close deals faster.

description: SEATTLE, Wash. - Former Auburn women #39;s basketball player Le #39;Coe Willingham will play in the WNBA Finals title game here Tuesday night as part of the Connecticut Sun team in their matchup with the Seattle Storm.

title: Prso: No fears over Boum bust
description: RANGERS striker Dado Prso today backed crocked team mate Jean-Alain Boumsong to make a rapid recovery from his leg injury. The French internationalist limped off in the first half of the 1-1 draw with Inverness Caley Thistle at Pittodrie yesterday.

description: President Bush and Sen. John Kerry accused each other of lacking the hard-nosed resolve of Cold War presidents -- from Democrat Truman to Republican Reagan -- reaching across party lines

title: Orica profit trebles to \$328m net
description: CHEMICAL, paint and explosives manufacturer Orica tripled its net profit in 2003-04, booking a bottom-line result of \$327.8 million and forecasting further growth on the back of strong demand from the mining sector.

title: Ruddock sees need to take big scalp as trial by pace awaits Wales
description: Graham Henry and Steve Hansen - are pitted against a former pupil - Mike Ruddock. Wales coach Ruddock could not have had it much harder.

title: QB shuffle fails to pay off for Dolphins
description: Dave Wannstedt wasn #39;t happy with Jay Fiedler on Saturday, and the feeling was mutual. Wannstedt benched Fiedler at halftime of the Miami Dolphins #39; 17-7 loss to the Tennessee Titans, and the quarterback said he was disappointed about the quick hook.

description: Three Hollywood studios choose to use next-generation DVD technology backed by Toshiba, snubbing a rival product promoted by Sony.

description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia Sept. 20, 2004 - The spread of HIV/AIDS is fueling a massive tuberculosis crisis that could see one billion people infected in the next 20 years, the UN warned Monday.

title: AT amp;T to cut about 7,000 jobs

title: New Induce Act Alarms Foes
description: The latest version of the Induce Act, headed for markup this week, is basically the same as the first version, critics say. It could mean trouble for companies that had no intention of inducing copyright infringement. By Katie Dean.

title: IMF says markets at most resilient in 3 years
description: The global financial system is at its most resilient since the equity bubble burst in 2001, the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday, despite rising interest rates, heightened security and higher oil prices.

title: Ferguson has no fears for record buy Rooney
description: Alex Ferguson has moved quickly to put a protective shield around teenage striker Wayne Rooney - and Manchester United #39;s new record signing insists he is mature enough to evade the pitfalls that could derail his emerging career.

title: FACTBOX-Luigi Del Neri factbox
description: - After a modest playing career in Serie A and B with Spal, Foggia, Novara and Udinese, Del Neri takes up his first coaching job in August 1990 with Teramo in Serie C2, Italy #39;s fourth division.

title: Single molecule may lead to nicotine addiction
description: A single molecule may be partly to blame for nicotine #39;s addictive allure, a finding that researchers say could lead to potential therapies to help millions of smokers quit.

description: Sonics general manager Rick Sund likes to boast that the core of his team consists of young players who are unfinished basketball products.

title: Halifax Sees Home Price Drop
Spitzer Arrives at Scene of Galactic Collision
description: NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope has set its infrared sight on a major galactic collision and witnessed not death, but a teeming nest of life. The colliding galaxies, called the Antennae galaxies, are in the process of merging together.

title: Oracle readies CRM updates
description: Oracle Corp. plans to release the latest version of its CRM (customer relationship management) applications within the next two months, as part of an ongoing update of its E-Business Suite.

description: Islanders spotted Tiger Woods snorkeling off the coast of Barbados on Monday, while reports persisted that the golf star planned to marry Swedish model Elin Nordegren in a ceremony at a luxury resort this week.

title: Afghanistan Bomb Attacks Kill 16
description: At least 16 people, many of them children, were killed in explosions at the office of a US security contractor in Afghanistans capital and a school in the south east as the country moves towards its first post-Taliban election.

title: Missouri joins prescription drug program
description: Missouri is joining Illinois and Wisconsin in importing prescription drugs from Canada, Britain and Ireland. Gov. Bob Holden appeared at a news conference with Illinois Gov.

description: Despite myriad miscues, Florida State rallied from a seven-point halftime deficit to defeat Syracuse 17-13 before 40,539 fans at the Carrier Dome.

title: Mauresmo drops out of the Fed Cup
description: PARIS, France -- France #39;s Amelie Mauresmo has pulled out of next week #39;s Fed Cup tennis finals in Moscow because of a groin injury.

title: Brown accused of  #39;baby bonds bribe #39;
description: A treasury plan to distribute baby bond vouchers worth almost 1 billion weeks before the likely date of the next election was condemned by the Tories last night as a  quot;cynical bribe quot;.

title: Former Bush Official on Cybersecurity Returns to Government
description: Howard Schmidt, now at eBay, will chair Homeland Security Dept.'s Computer Emergency Response Team.

title: Happy 100th Birthday to the Banana Split
description: PITTSBURGH - University of Pittsburgh alumni have won the Nobel Prize, played in the National Football League and unlocked the secrets of DNA. On Wednesday, the university celebrated a less prestigious but equally sweet accomplishment - the banana split...

title: Airbus challenging new Boeing aircraft
description: Airbus shareholders have approved the launch of a new passenger jet, aimed at challenging Boeing #39;s 7E7. A spokesman for the European consortium says the new widebody -he A-350  -l be

title: Car bomb explodes near Fallujah; reports of US casualties
description: A car bomb exploded on the outskirts of Fallujah on Monday and there were reports of US casualties, a US military official said on condition of anonymity.

description: The Scottish Football Association hope to unveil Walter Smith as the new Scotland manager at 1pm today. SFA chief executive David Taylor arrived at Hampden Park this morning ahead of the 10am board meeting

description: Secretary of State Colin L. Powell said yesterday that President Bush will place a high priority in his second term on granting legal status

title: PC Shipments Rise 12 Percent Worldwide
description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Shipments of personal computers  in the third quarter rose 12 percent, driven by strong  corporate demand and ongoing strength in Europe, the Middle  East and Africa, a market research firm said on Monday.

title: Man who tried to save family dies
description: GLENDALE HEIGHTS, Ill. A 25-year-old Glendale Heights man has died, more than a week after he was burned while trying to save his girlfriend and their children from a fire in their home.

title: Shell to spend \$45B (US) to replace reserves
description: LONDON (AP-CP) - Royal Dutch/Shell Group said today it will spend \$45 billion (US) and sell up to \$12 billion worth of assets to reinvigorate its underperforming oil and natural gas business.

title: Gough delighted to snap up Knox as right-hand man
description: RICHARD GOUGH, the new Livingston manager, insists he has already made his best-ever signing for the club by convincing Archie Knox, the former Rangers and Manchester United coach, to be his No 2 at Almondvale.

title: High hopes for Cassini #39;s Titan flyby
description: The Cassini mission is set to reveal the first close view of Saturn #39;s giant moon Titan. At 1744 BST on Tuesday, the spacecraft will skim within 1200 kilometres of the moon - close enough for radar to penetrate

title: Oracle wins battle for PeopleSoft
description: Oracle has signed a definitive agreement to acquire PeopleSoft for \$26.50 (13.79) per share, or about \$10.3bn. The transaction has been approved by both companies #39; boards of directors and is expected to close by early January.

title: Evanston Hospital will not meet deadline to shut down waste ...
description: September 14, 2004 - Evanston Hospital officials say they will not be able to meet the north suburb #39;s new deadline to shut down their medical waste incinerator.

title: Millions tune in for Joey debut
description: An estimated 18.6 million people tune in to watch the debut episode of Joey in the US.

title: Hewitt through to final
description: Lleyton Hewitt reached the final of the TD Waterhouse Cup on Long Island after semi-final opponent Dmitry Tursunov retired hurt. The Australian second seed was 6-3 1-0 ahead when the Russian decided to quit because of a back injury.

title: Actress Liv gives birth to baby son
description: Lord of the Rings actress Liv Tyler has given birth to a baby son, making Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler a grandfather. Tyler, whose mother is the legendary model and rock groupie Bebe Buell, gave birth in New York on Tuesday.

title: Update 2: Tokyo Stocks End Lower, Dollar Flat
description: Tokyo stocks fell for a seventh straight session Monday amid concerns about rising oil prices. The dollar was flat against the Japanese yen.

title: Microsoft hit by monopoly suits
description: Several California cities and counties have sued Microsoft, accusing the software giant of illegally charging inflated prices for its products because of monopoly control of the personal computer operating systems market.

title: Child Vein Changes a Give-Away to Future Strokes
description: EXETER, England (Reuters) - Minute changes in tiny blood  vessels close to the surface of the skin in children as young  as 11 can indicate the risk of future heart attacks or strokes,  a leading scientist said on Monday.

title: Gold Holds Above \$400 in Asia
description: SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Gold was steady at above \$400 in Asia  on Tuesday on Japanese buying, but other precious metals were  volatile ahead of the release of more U.S. data, dealers said.

title: Tom Brokaw exits NBC #39;s  quot;Nightly News
description: THERE #39;S SOMETHING to be said about going out on top, seeing that last jump shot swish through the net or the final profit report stuffed with extra zeros.

description: Spending hours staring at a computer may raise the risk of glaucoma, an eye disease that can lead to blindness, scientists say. The discovery contradicts years of advice that suggested that

title: Cleanup after Tropical Storm Gaston underway
description: While skies were clear over coastal South Carolina on Monday it was clear that Tropical Storm Gaston swept through the region a day earlier with near-hurricane force winds.

title: Fight Breaks Out During Vibe Awards Taping (AP)
description: AP - A fight broke out near the stage at the Vibe awards ceremony as rapper Snoop Dogg and producer Quincy Jones were preparing to honor Dr. Dre.

title: Baseball Owners to Vote on Expos Move (AP)
description: AP - Baseball commissioner Bud Selig scheduled a conference call for Friday for owners to vote on the proposed move of the Montreal Expos to Washington.

title: This Date in Baseball for Oct. 5 (AP)
description: AP - 1941  #151; Brooklyn catcher Mickey Owen dropped a third strike on Tommy Henrich of what would have been the last out of a Dodgers victory against the New York Yankees. Given the second chance, the Yankees scored four runs for a 7-4 victory and a 3-1 lead in the World Series, which they ended up winning.

title: Eurostar workers vote to strike
description: Eurostar workers vote in favour of strikes over pay and threaten disruptions during the August Bank Holiday weekend.

title: Head-On Train Collision in India Kills 27
description: Welders cut through metal, and soldiers pulled bodies from the crushed cars of two trains that collided head-on Tuesday in northern India, killing 31 people.

title: Children #39;s Place to Buy Disney Stores
description: Children #39;s Place Retail Stores Inc. (PLCE.O: Quote, Profile, Research) said on Wednesday it will buy 313 retail stores from Walt Disney Co.

description: The British grand prix at Silverstone will be included on formula one #39;s draft 2005 calendar when it is published tomorrow, according to sources close to the negotiations.

description: This fall, the directors Bill Condon ("Kinsey") and Pedro Almodvar ("Bad Education") seem smarter about sex than nearly everyone else.

description: DESPITE what the song says, you have to be pretty chirpy to love Paris in the autumn when it drizzles, as it #39;s done all week, especially when the tennis often matches the grey and lifeless skies.

title: Search companies vye for the desktop
description: All the major Web portals seem to be rushing delivery on one product this holiday: desktop search software. Microsoft plans to introduce a test version of its desktop search application in the coming days, meeting its stated deadline by a nose.
